result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on February 10, 2023 at 11:00 am.

re: rescheduling 10/20 hearing to feb 2023. Filed by Atty Petersen. arc        Approved by EFV on 10/18/22. JA scheduled PLEAS with Atty Petersen's Office and DA. JA attempted to contact DE to notify her of the cancelled hearing on 10/20/22, but the voicemail was not yet set up. gll
Filed by ADA Ellenwood. arc   e: Atty Petersen

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Walmart- Hudson, WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:26 PM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Melissa M. Petersen in court for Courtney Jean Ryks Usher. Defendant Courtney Jean Ryks Usher in court. DE obtained counsel. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Bond arguments. Court orders bond. Enters NG plea. Waives speedy trial. Court sets SETC and PSC. Adjourned 01:29 PM
Settlement conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
